results.section:
戏稳定贡献，以及《三角洲行动》等新品带动下，增
值服务在第三季度实现收入95,860百万元，同比增长16%。营销服务业务受视频号、电商小程序及
搜索广告放量拉动，实现收入36,242百万元，同比增长21%，是各业务中增速最快的板块。金融科
技与企业服务收入58,174百万元，同比增长10%，商业支付保持稳定增长，云业务在AI应用推动下
呈结构性改善。毛利方面，公司第三季度毛利108,798百万元，同比提升22%，毛利率从上年同期
的53%升至56%，反映游戏与广告业务高毛利结构的提升效果，以及AI带来的效率优化。经营利润
63,555百万元，同比增长19%，经营利润率升至33%。期内归母净利润63,133百万元，同比增长19%；
非IFRS归母净利润70,549百万元，同比增长18%。利润增速持续快于收入，显示公司在成本控制、
产品结构升级以及投资收益改善方面取得成效，整体盈利质量向好。
截至2025年9月30日，腾讯总资产达到2,073,272 百万元，较2024年底显著增长，主要因金融
资产公允价值上升及经营活动产生现金增加。流动资产中，现金及现金等价物为159,982百万元，

results.title: 腾讯控股2025年三季度业绩分析：显著超出预期，因AI驱动各业务线增长；买入（摘要）
results.section:
步加速），且利润稳步复合增长（调整后营业利润增长18%；参
见我们的简要分析报告），这进一步印证了我们对公司的积极看法。
我们认为，独特的微信生态和全球游戏资产，加之多种变现杠杆，应
能支持腾讯实现穿越宏观周期的盈利复合增长。我们仍认为，鉴于AI
赋能公司所有业务线（游戏、广告、金融科技、云、电商），腾讯是
中国互联网行业中最有望从AI持续应用中获益的公司之一。其中，两
大高质量收入来源（游戏和营销服务）均连续三个季度同比增长超
20%。 
我们将2025-27年收入预测上调0~1%，以反映在AI持续应用带来的利
好下，游戏、营销服务和金融科技/企业服务的增长持久性改善；并
将2025-27年净利润预测微调-1~0%，因更强劲的收入增长被费用上
升（包括AI算力的租赁费用、推广AI原生应用的营销费用以及AI项目
的研发投入，如聘用待遇更高的技术人才）所抵消。我们的12个月目
标价格仍为770港元。基于三季度的稳健业绩，腾讯仍是我们在中国
互联网板块的首选股之一，而游戏是我们最青睐的子板块。

• 
游戏：给予 15 倍未来 12 个月 P/E，与网易目标15 倍P/E 相近，并相较于行业平均的10 倍给予合理溢
价，因为腾讯具有更强的竞争优势：规模更大、行业地位领先、且在海外游戏市场的表现强劲。 
• 
社交：给予 15 倍未来 12 个月P/E，高于同行 12 倍的均值，因为腾讯背靠微信强大的生态系统，拥有更
坚实的品牌和产品护城河。 
• 
广告：给予25 倍未来12 个月 P/E，高于我们给予Meta 的目标市盈率21 倍，主因腾讯同比增速预计约
25%，显著高于Meta 的低双位数增长，且腾讯微信生态基于人工智能驱动，通过视频号、搜索及小程序进
一步拓展了增长与变现潜力。 
• 
云计算/企业服务：我们给予5 倍未来12 个月P/S，与阿里巴巴的目标P/S 一致。 
• 
金融科技：给予 10 倍未来 12 个月 P/E，主因宏观消费影响，增速较低。

盈利预测与投资建议。AI 人才和团队投入加大，将AI 资源聚焦投入更

Company Description
Tencent has the largest online community in China. It was founded with the launch of instant 
messaging platform QQ but has since grown into a diversified internet company with core 
focuses on gaming, social media and networking (Weixin/WeChat), fintech (WeChat Pay), 
cloud computing and digital content. The company also holds a substantial investment 
portfolio of public and private companies.
Valuation Method and Risk Statement
Our price target is based on sum of the parts. 
We believe the key risks for Tencent include: 1) an evolving and intensifying competitive 
landscape; 2) new business execution; 3) integration of invested companies and businesses; 
4) rising costs of traffic acquisition, content and brand promotions; 5) IT system upkeep; 6) 
expansion into international markets; 7) infringement of intellectual property rights; 8) 
departures of key management; and 9) regulatory risks.

请务必阅读正文之后的免责条款和声明。 
 
风险分析 
宏观经济风险：国内经济增长放缓、消费疲软可能影响其广告、游戏及支付等核心业务收入。人民币汇率
波动亦带来汇兑风险。 
行业监管风险：中国对互联网平台持续强化反垄断、数据安全及未成年人保护监管，可能限制其扩张节奏
与盈利模式；游戏版号审批不确定性也构成政策风险。 
竞争风险：腾讯面临来自字节跳动（短视频与信息流广告）、阿里巴巴（电商与云服务）、快手及B 站（内
容生态）等多方夹击，用户时长和广告预算争夺日趋激烈，部分新兴业务如视频号虽增长迅速，但商业化效率
和用户黏性仍需验证。 
执行层面风险：新业务（如企业服务、海外游戏）投入周期长、回报不确定；国际化进程中遭遇地缘政治
摩擦与本地化挑战；组织架构频繁调整可能影响战略落地效率与人才稳定性。 
投资风险：腾讯作为大型投资方，其参投的大量初创企业若因市场变化或自身经营不善而失败，也可能造
成资产减值。

results.title: Key Call: Tencent Holdings: Games and Cloud event sharing takeaway
results.section:
ab
17 December 2025
Global Research
First Read
Key Call: Tencent Holdings
Games and Cloud event sharing takeaway
Cloud: International market  presents significant opportunities 
Tencent Cloud International operates 64 availability zones across 22 regions globally. In 
the presentation, management used the SEA market as an example to highlight 
Tencent’s success despite entering the market late. Competitive advantage: Notable 
clients include CP Group (the largest conglomerate in Thailand), which is now fully 
running on Tencent Cloud. Recent wins also include GoTo Group, for which Tencent 
differentiated by offering more competitive pricing, faster services, innovative and 
localized solutions.  Growth potential for SEA:  Management sees significant growth 
potential, including strong demand for a variety of high margin SaaS products and 
coding software—especially as SEA has fewer programmers vs China—and Tencent is 
pushing CodeBuddy and embedding AI coding tools to support local engineering teams 
(particularly useful in handling less structured data). Compared with China, the SEA 
market is also less competitive on pricing. Management sees now as a good opportunity 
to scale up after cloud customers have been educated by the incumbents.  Strategy: 
After winning several high profile KAs, management believes it will be easier to acquire 
SMEs and long tail customers going forward. On top of cost advantages, Tencent’s edge 
includes its expertise in media related areas (e.g. live streaming), a nimble and innovative 
team (able to tailor for local demand), and strong technical capabilities (e.g., running 
DeepSeek more efficiently with the highest benchmark on Tencent’s AI infrastructure).
Online game potential: Shooting game and international opportunities
Dominating shooting game market: Following the success of Delta Force and 
Valorant, Tencent uses the shooting game genre to showcase its market potential and 
how the company captures, creates, and leads evolvi

results.title: Tencent Holdings Ltd.: Business Sharing Takeaways
results.section:
M
 Idea
Tencent Holdings Ltd.  | Asia Pacific
Business Sharing Takeaways 
We attended Tencent's business sharing in Bangkok where 
management outlines its strategies on international cloud and 
games. While Tencent's overseas games have started to bear 
fruit this year, we believe its international cloud opportunities 
are underappreciated by the market. OW and Top Pick.  
Tencent Cloud International: 
• Tencent Cloud covers 22 regions, 64 available zones, 200T reserved 
bandwidth, and 3,200+ acceleration nodes. In ASEAN, Tencent Cloud has 
three IDCs in both Thailand (third to be completed in coming months) and 
Indonesia, making it a leading cloud service provider (CSP) in the region.
• Key competitors in ASEAN include US and China  CSPs. We think Tencent's 
key advantages include competitive pricing, vertical experience (media, 
fintech, etc.), and in-house developed PaaS/SaaS solutions. Recent major 
customer acquisitions include GoTo (GoJek on-demand delivery)  in Indonesia 
and CP Group (supermarkets and department stores) in Thailand.
• HY2.0 is the first foundation model upgrade after restructuring its AI 
research lab ~6 months ago, with high-quality training datasets and 
revamped model architecture, which has been integrated into Tencent's apps. 
Tencent has sufficient chips for model training, although inference 
represents 70%+ of compute power. The company continues to prioritize 
chips for internal use and de-emphasize pure chip rental businesses.
Tencent Games (Overseas Games / Shooting Games Genre):
• China studios' success factors include: 1) Productivity differentials (labour, 
tools, work practices); 2) Category dynamics (martial arts, anime open world, 
competitive PVP, mobile strategy, mobile hyper causal); and 3) Products vs. 
platforms (apps stores, UGC, ads networks).
• Tencent believes its success factors include: 1) Data (exploring GaaS data and 
practices from China to rest of world); 2) Tools (bringing tools from rest of 
world to China)

results.title: Tencent Holdings: Key takeaways from business sharing; reiterate sector top pick
results.section:
, making it well positioned to capture the upcoming new genre opportunities. 
AI already benefiting game productivity and engagement 
Tencent has been actively incorporating AI to its workflow and product feature. AI 
technology has become a core pillar of its online game R&D workflow, boosting art and 
code generation efficiency, creating AI-supported in-game coaches to improve new 
player retention, and enhancing anti-cheat systems. AI also allows rapidly prototyping 
new game concepts with faster idea/gameplay iteration than before. On group level, AI 
adoption has been massive, with 90+% of engineers using AI coding tools like 
CodeBuddy, which now generates 50+% of new code.  
Good timing for international cloud expansion 
In cloud computing, the company is rapidly expanding its physical infrastructure in high-
growth Southeast Asian markets like Thailand and Indonesia to better service anchor 
clients such as CP Group and GoTo. This onshore infrastructure provides a key 
competitive edge against Western vendors by drastically reducing latency and cost. 
Tencent Cloud differentiates itself by not just providing compute capability but through 
a full-stack software and AI solution, offering clients options to adopt multiple-AI 
services on top of a unified cloud infrastructure. Management sees benign competition 
landscape in SEA markets and believes now is a good time to expand as Western cloud 
providers have already educated the market, and customers are now seeking cost-
effective, localized alternatives.  
    
 
16 December 2025

results.section:
赋能最新动态。
国信互联网观点：
海外云业务：基础设施先行，全球基础设施加速扩容，形成深耕亚洲、发力中东、辐射欧美格局。腾讯云
采取“基础设施先行”策略，在亚洲、中东、欧美加速数据中心布局，目前已覆盖全球22 个地区。其核
心优势在于技术领先（如媒体云、音视频传输、Fintech 场景）与深度本地化服务。通过成功迁移印尼GoTo、
泰国正大集团等标杆客户，证明了其以“高性价比”和优化架构（如提升响应速度、本地IDC 部署）切入
市场的能力。海外竞争相对温和，腾讯主攻聚焦在SaaS 和PaaS 业务，海外客户主要包含中企出海、本地
互联网企业等。面对芯片供应等问题，腾讯优先保障内部模型训练芯片储备，同时利用CPU 资源支撑推
理场景需求。除此以外，很多海外客户自身拥有GPU 资源，腾讯帮助客户更好地利用这些资源。
海外游戏业务：工业化能力兑现，GaaS 能力赋能。2025 年腾讯海外游戏增长强劲（Q3 同比+43%），我们
预计全年收入达757 亿元，占比腾讯游戏32%，提升3pct。加速主要系①腾讯工业化能力近年来逐渐成熟；
②收购海外游戏需要有4-5 年积累才能看到效果。腾讯合作态

组合拳，在强敌环伺的市场中撕开缺口。 
首先，基础设施的激进扩张是赢得信任的基石。过去两年，腾讯云在泰国和印尼的
布局速度惊人，均建立了包含三个可用区（3AZ）的高等级数据中心架构。这种最
高等级的拓扑结构不仅是服务GoTo、正大集团等大型企业的硬性门槛，也为进入对
稳定性要求极高的金融服务（FSI）市场奠定了物理基础。特别是对于拥有丰富电
力资源的锁定，使得腾讯云相比部分面临电力短缺的竞争对手拥有了更强的供应稳
定性。 
在客户突破方面，腾讯云成功树立了“以技术换市场”的标杆案例。在印尼，腾讯
云击败了Google Cloud，成功将印尼最大互联网平台 GoTo 的按需服务（网约车与
外卖）实现了100%的全量迁移。这一胜利的关键在于直击客户痛点：通过将数据从
境外迁回印尼本地数据中心，使每笔交易延迟降低了30 毫秒，显著提升了5000 万
用户的体验，同时提供了优于竞对的性价比。在泰国，腾讯云击败了国内同行的竞
争，承载了正大集团（CP Group）旗下莲花超市与万客隆的数字化底座，证明了其
在传统实体巨头数字化转型中的服务能力。这种由大客户（KA）驱动的策略，不仅
建立了市场信誉

Investment rationale 
We like Tencent for its best combination of AI-application-driven growth/stable 
competition/top shareholder returns at attractive valuation. We see Tencent as China's 
leading agentic AI company, with Weixin as the most natural mobile interface for LLM 
and AI agent integration. Within online game sector, Tencent is the clear leader in China 
with over 70% mobile game revenue market share. The company is leveraging its 
extensive game portfolio and operational expertise to capture emerging gameplay trends 
and diversify content globally. In addition to online game, Tencent captures significant 
spending-share and mind-share in virtual experience-based consumption market in 
China. Tencent operates China's largest online video/online music/online literature 
platforms in terms of paying user, with footprint now expanding into international 
markets.  
 
Upside catalysts 
• 
Stronger game performance during the peak season  
• 
Potential introduction of additional AI features within Weixin app 
• 
Potential upside in CAPEX driven by improved chip availability 
 
Risks 
• 
Competition from new traffic platforms and media formats 
• 
Regulatory risks across fintech, data collection and usage, online games, instant 
messaging, wireless services, app registration, minors’ protection 
• 
Weaker momentum for new game titles

International cloud: selective wedges, AI tooling export, and what 
“success” should look like
Tencent Cloud’s international strategy is explicitly structured around 
efficient market entry and wedge widening. The go-to-market logic is to 
win key accounts (KAs) as showcases (GoTo cited) to build credibility and 
lower SME acquisition cost, with SME growth accelerated by KA success. 
This is paired with geographic prioritization (Thailand/Indonesia) and 
localized infrastructure investment (e.g., third data center in Thailand) to 
improve reliability and address enterprise needs. 
Differentiation is described less as a brute-force hyperscaler fight and more as 
vertical PaaS positioning – Tencent highlights strength in media and fintech 
solutions (including video/audio processing PaaS) and notes that some 
Western competitors have exited certain media services, creating openings. 
Investment Thesis 
As one of the most consensus OW names in the China internet space, Tencent’s solid operations should be sufficient for 
existing shareholders to hold onto positions but likely insufficient for incremental buyers. As a result, we believe upside to 
the current share price largely lies in earnings compound growth until changing fundamentals lead to a narrative change and 
valuatio

e on Tencent’s ability to capture 
major game genre shift globally and grow cloud/AI business rapidly outside China. As 
stated in our recent China Internet Quarterly Chartbook and Monthly Game Tracker (see 
notes), Tencent remains our sector top pick for the best combination of AI-application-
driven growth/stable competition/top shareholder returns at attractive valuation.  
Well-positioned on global game genre shift 
Tencent is a key company in the shooting genre games globally through franchises like 
Peacekeeper Elite, PUBG Mobile and Valorant, and is systematically investing to extend 
this leadership into emerging markets and new gameplay trends (e.g. Extraction mode). 
Management highlighted global game publishing strategy that involves deep 
localization—conducting market research, partnering with local IPs, and running targeted 
marketing campaigns. Looking ahead, Tencent is executing a product-led approach that 
combines Chinese industrialization productivity with international creativity, plus 
leveraging China's advanced "games-as-a-platform" operational experience. Management 
sees a rich diversity of content and studios in Tencent's game portfolio (“LVMH for 
games”), making it well positioned to capture the upcoming new genre opportunities. 
AI already benefiting game productivity and engagement 
Tencent has been actively incorporating AI to its workflow and product feature. AI 
technology has become a core pillar of its online game R&D workflow, boosting art and 
code generation efficiency, creating AI-supported in-game coaches to improve new 
player retention, and enhancing anti-cheat systems. AI also allows rapidly prototyping 
new game concepts with faster idea/gameplay iteration than before. On group level, AI 
adoption has been massive, with 90+% of engineers using AI coding tools like 
CodeBuddy, which now generates 50+% of new code.  
Good timing for international cloud expansion 
In cloud computing, the company is rapidly expanding its physi

Global Research

Key Call: Tencent Holdings
Games and Cloud event sharing takeaway
Cloud: International market  presents significant opportunities 
Tencent Cloud International operates 64 availability zones across 22 regions globally. In 
the presentation, management used the SEA market as an example to highlight 
Tencent’s success despite entering the market late. Competitive advantage: Notable 
clients include CP Group (the largest conglomerate in Thailand), which is now fully 
running on Tencent Cloud. Recent wins also include GoTo Group, for which Tencent 
differentiated by offering more competitive pricing, faster services, innovative and 
localized solutions.  Growth potential for SEA:  Management sees significant growth 
potential, including strong demand for a variety of high margin SaaS products and 
coding software—especially as SEA has fewer programmers vs China—and Tencent is 
pushing CodeBuddy and embedding AI coding tools to support local engineering teams 
(particularly useful in handling less structured data). Compared with China, the SEA 
market is also less competitive on pricing. Management sees now as a good opportunity 
to scale up after cloud customers have been educated by the incumbents.  Strategy: 
After winning several high profile KAs, management believes it will be easier to acquire 
SMEs and long tail customers going forward. On top of cost advantages, Tencent’s edge 
includes its expertise in media related areas (e.g. live streaming), a nimble and innovative 
team (able to tailor for local demand), and strong technical capabilities (e.g., running 
DeepSeek more efficiently with the highest benchmark on Tencent’s AI infrastructure).
Online game potential: Shooting game and international opportunities

What are TC’s strengths?
On traditional Iaas/Paas services, TC has leveraged its "battle-tested" capabilities from 
WeChat and gaming to have established a competitive edge in the Media cloud vertical, 
offering superior live streaming and real-time communication (RTC) solutions compared to 
competitors. Service quality acts as a further differentiator, with TC providing "white glove" 
localized engineering support that US hyperscalers often lack, which was a key factor in 
the GoTo/CP wins, according to management. Furthermore, Tencent offers unique 
connectivity with the vast Chinese consumer market for those international enterprises 
from travel, retail and hospitality industries that want to reach Chinese consumers via 
Tencent’s powerful WeChat ecosystem. 
On AI Infrastructure, TC positions itself as a "toolbox" provider, TC offers a full-stack AI 
solution from infrastructure to Agentic AI tools. A key advantage lies in operational 
efficiency; through deeply optimized storage and computation connections, TC claims to 
have achieved higher token production efficiency per GPU unit compared to standard 
setups.
Price war is more benign in SEA
Compared to the domestic cloud market in China, Tencent thinks the competition in the 
SEA cloud market has been more benign so far. This is partially because customers in 
that market value service reliability, local support, and specific product capabilities over 
just the cheapest service provi

results.title: Tencent Holdings Ltd.: Business Sharing Takeaways
results.section:
M
 Idea
Tencent Holdings Ltd.  | Asia Pacific
Business Sharing Takeaways 
We attended Tencent's business sharing in Bangkok where 
management outlines its strategies on international cloud and 
games. While Tencent's overseas games have started to bear 
fruit this year, we believe its international cloud opportunities 
are underappreciated by the market. OW and Top Pick.  
Tencent Cloud International: 
• Tencent Cloud covers 22 regions, 64 available zones, 200T reserved 
bandwidth, and 3,200+ acceleration nodes. In ASEAN, Tencent Cloud has 
three IDCs in both Thailand (third to be completed in coming months) and 
Indonesia, making it a leading cloud service provider (CSP) in the region.
• Key competitors in ASEAN include US and China  CSPs. We think Tencent's 
key advantages include competitive pricing, vertical experience (media, 
fintech, etc.), and in-house developed PaaS/SaaS solutions. Recent major 
customer acquisitions include GoTo (GoJek on-demand delivery)  in Indonesia 
and CP Group (supermarkets and department stores) in Thailand.
• HY2.0 is the first foundation model upgrade after restructuring its AI 
research lab ~6 months ago, with high-quality training datasets and 
revamped model architecture, which has been integrated into Tencent's apps. 
Tencent has sufficient chips for model training, although inference 
represents 70%+ of compute power. The company continues to prioritize 
chips for internal use and de-emphasize pure chip rental businesses.
Tencent Games (Overseas Games / Shooting Games Genre):
• China studios' success factors include: 1) Productivity differentials (labour, 
tools, work practices); 2) Category dynamics (martial arts, anime open world, 
competitive PVP, mobile strategy, mobile hyper causal); and 3) Products vs. 
platforms (apps stores, UGC, ads networks).
• Tencent believes its success factors include: 1) Data (exploring GaaS data and 
practices from China to rest of world); 2) Tools (bringing tools from rest of 
world to China)

results.title: Quick Note - Tencent Holdings (700 HK) (Buy) - An overhang for Tencent
results.section:
l closely track whether the latest incident 
may affect its ability to maintain its relationship with global business partners and to 
acquire overseas gamers.
What’s next?
According to Global Times , Tencent indicated that it will work with the DoD to address 
any misunderstanding. If the direct negotiation with DoD fails, we think Tencent may bring 
this case to a US court in order to get the DoD ruling overturned. 
Xiaomi (1810 HK, Buy; covered by Donne Teng) was added by the US DoD to the list of 
Communist Chinese Military Companies (CCMC) on 14 January 2021 during the final 
days of President Trump’s first term. This decision was revoked by the US DoD on 27 May 
2021 under the Biden Administration, after Xiaomi brought the case to a US court which 
ruled in favour of Xiaomi.  
To bring the case to a US court is likely the final resort Tencent can tap which may take 
longer than it did for Xiaomi. One key difference in the Tencent case vs Xiaomi is the 
current political climate, in our view. In the case of Xiaomi, the decision to add it into the 
CCMC list was made by President Trump’s DoD and was eventually revoked by President 
Biden’s DoD which accepted the ruling of the court instead of filing an appeal. In Tencent’s 
case, its journey to seek justice might turn out to be increasingly tough under the incoming 
President Trump administration which seems more hawkish towards Chinese enterprises.
The Tencent stock was an outperformer in 2024 backed by strong earnings growth and 
generous buyback (up 44%, vs. HSTECH index up 19%). While we think its fundamental 
story remains intact, the latest event does consist of an overhang for the Tencent stock in 
the near-term as the market has already been edgy about the geopolitical risks for 
Chinese equities. 
Valuation and risks
We maintain our Buy rating and SOTP-based TP of HKD500. We value Tencent's online 
gaming business at USD148bn, based on FY25F P/E of 13x, online advertising business 
at USD164bn, based on

Geopolitics: complex but we see an attractive risk reward  
Following a quiet 2024 on the regulatory front, 2025 returned to recent form.  On 6th 
January, the Pentagon issued its annual list of entities they qualify as ‘Chinese military 
companies’, referencing section 1260 of National Defence Authorisation Act, adding 
Tencent to the list. Despite the concerning nature of the headline, the substantive impact 
for Tencent is minimal. The only limits are on contracts with the Department of Defence, 
which are not relevant for Tencent operations. Additionally, the designation can also be 
removed via an appeal process or legal action, which Tencent have indicated they are 
looking to pursue to resolve the ‘mistake’. In response to the Section 1260 and 
consequent share price reaction, Tencent i) issued an ad hoc press release emphasising 
their innocence over any wrongdoing and plans to appeal and ii) instituted the largest 
daily buyback in history the days following the news emphasising their confidence in the 
group’s outlook (now on hiatus as the group is in blackout) iii) The Office of U.S. Trade 
Representative (USTR) on January 8, 2025, removed WeChat/Weixin from Notorious 
Markets for Counterfeiting and Privacy List (Notorious Markets List, or NML).

results.title: 【中泰计算机】中望软件与ITC仲裁事宜公告速评
results.section:
事件简况：公司发布公告，ITC联盟向波特兰仲裁处提请仲裁，认为公司违反与其之间的合同义务，向韩国 ZYX 公司授予IntelliCAD软件相关技术的许可权或软件访问权限，并提出不少于约242万美元的赔偿金及罚息、技术服务等其他相关费用。公司对此主张不予认可，并将积极做好各项应对工作。目前本仲裁已获受理，暂未开始审理。

#先说结论：对公司经营基本没有影响。

1）公司已于2025年7月9日正式终止在ITC的会员关系，且更早之时公司2D产品即已实现技术与代码全部自主化。我们判断公司自身产品销售基本不会受到任何影响。
2）关于与韩国ZYX公司的技术授权，这部分业务规模非常小，且公司在韩国的业务拓展并不依赖于这种方式与这家公司。

与之前和ADSK的诉讼相比，#我们判断本次仲裁事件影响更为可控且基本为一次性因素。

欢迎交流！

风险提示：诉讼风险、产品与技术研发风险、下游需求恢复不及预期等。

当前诉讼状态：已完成Markman听证会，法官对专利权利要求的解释对Arbutus有利。Moderna援引美国法典第1498条，主张政府担责（需向联邦索赔法院起诉政府而非Moderna），此抗辩大概率不成立。审判时间从2025年9月推迟至2026年3月，可能再调整。待决程序有简易判决动议和Daubert动议（涉Arbutus专家证词与证据可采性，排除将削弱其案件）。受假期影响，进度近期放缓，预计2026年初恢复。
关键时间节点：2022年2月，针对Moderna提起诉讼；同年，Moderna基于1498条的驳回动议被拒（需事实发现后再决）；2023年，政府提交利益声明，称1498条仅适用于“C101”合同；2025年8月，政府介入案件；11月提交Daubert动议（结果未决）；审判定于2026年3月9日。1498法规适用争议1498法规内容解析：1498法规最早于1910年颁布，后进行了修订。其颁布背景与一战时期的军事采购需求相关，旨在解决承包商因专利问题不敢生产武器的困境。法规核心规则包括：政府被允许实施专利侵权行为，但需支付合理赔偿，专利权人无法阻止政府侵权；损害赔偿范围有

Company Description
Tencent has the largest online community in China. It was founded with the launch of instant 
messaging platform QQ but has since grown into a diversified internet company with core 
focuses on gaming, social media and networking (Weixin/WeChat), fintech (WeChat Pay), 
cloud computing and digital content. The company also holds a substantial investment 
portfolio of public and private companies.
Valuation Method and Risk Statement
Our price target is based on sum of the parts. 
We believe the key risks for Tencent include: 1) an evolving and intensifying competitive 
landscape; 2) new business execution; 3) integration of invested companies and businesses; 
4) rising costs of traffic acquisition, content and brand promotions; 5) IT system upkeep; 6) 
expansion into international markets; 7) infringement of intellectual property rights; 8) 
departures of key management; and 9) regulatory risks.

位的影响可能有限，原因是中国平台案例的补救措施历来倾向于规范

压缩“基于规则”的优势，而非产生新的赢家。
以往先例：阿里巴巴、美团和腾讯对我们有何启示

月初收到处罚决定，包括罚款182.28 亿元（约占该决定所述的2019
年国内收入基数的4%），外加几年的合规报备/整改义务。对美团的
调查于2021 年4 月下旬得到公开报道，并于2021 年10 月上旬结束
，罚款34.42 亿元（约占所述2020 年国内销售额的3%）附加额外的
商家相关补救措施（包括退还部分“独家合作保证金”）。

results.title: 上市前夕再收36万罚单！小鹅通合规漏洞难堵，三年半累计亏损超9000万
results.section: 2025年11月，深圳小鹅网络技术有限公司（下称 “小鹅通”）收到深圳市市场监督管理局送达的《行政处罚决定书》（深市监处罚〔2025〕12 号），因存在网络交易违法行为，被处以36万元罚款。这已是小鹅通两年内第二次因同类问题被罚，距离其2025年8月向港交所递交招股书、冲刺主板上市仅过去三个月，合规隐忧成为其IPO路上的重要挑战。此次处罚依据《中华人民共和国电子商务法》第八十三条，直指小鹅通未履行平台核心责任：要么对平台内经营者侵害消费者合法权益的行为未采取必要措施，要么未对入驻商家尽到资质资格审核义务，要么未保障消费者安全权益。回溯2023年11月，小鹅通就曾因相同法律条款下的违规行为，被处以5万元罚款。短短两年内两次 “踩线”，暴露其在平台生态治理上的持续性漏洞 —— 尽管招股书中承诺 “禁止客户利用解决方案从事非法活动”，但实际运营中却未能有效落地监管措施。公开信息显示，小鹅通成立于2015年2月，核心产品 “小鹅通平台” 为企业提供产品交付、营销获客、用户运营等一站式服务，业务高度依赖腾讯生态：腾讯不仅是其最大外部股东（持股16.82%），更是其技术与流量核心 —— 服务多通过

Company Description
Tencent has the largest online community in China. It was founded with the launch of instant 
messaging platform QQ but has since grown into a diversified internet company with core 
focuses on gaming, social media and networking (Weixin/WeChat), fintech (WeChat Pay), 
cloud computing and digital content. The company also holds a substantial investment 
portfolio of public and private companies.
Valuation Method and Risk Statement
Our price target is based on sum of the parts. 
We believe the key risks for Tencent include: 1) an evolving and intensifying competitive 
landscape; 2) new business execution; 3) integration of invested companies and businesses; 
4) rising costs of traffic acquisition, content and brand promotions; 5) IT system upkeep; 6) 
expansion into international markets; 7) infringement of intellectual property rights; 8) 
departures of key management; and 9) regulatory risks.

请务必阅读正文之后的重要声明部分
一、概况：中国互联网“执牛耳者”
1.1 历史复盘：从即时通讯工具到社交巨头

1.1.1 历史沿革

回溯腾讯非典型成功史，自下而上的变革贯穿始终。《腾讯传》中提到
了一个细节，1999 年，在困境中的腾讯四处寻求投资，投资人考察项目
时问马化腾：“你怎么看你们公司的未来？”，结果生病的马化腾沉默
了一会儿说：“我也不知道”。

我们认为，这样看似弱规划、实则极灵动的发展方式，内核是对不确定
性的尊重和对极致好产品的追求的本心。许多人把这种边界感和责任心
归因于管理层的谨慎、不冒进和“书生气”，而我们觉得这并不是全部。

“蒂姆·伯纳斯-李（Tim Berners-Lee）在创造了互联网后，最终放弃
了对它的专利申请，因为他坚信互联网在创立第一天就应该是开放的、
自由的。腾讯的成功，是因为抓住机遇，也是因为践行了对互联网、对
全球化最原始的理想——那个开放的、自由的世界。”

results.section:

题，成为第一家真正“插旗”中东的游戏巨头 。 
印度适配： 针对当时印度市场主流包体仅 20-25MB 的硬件限制，腾讯将 700MB 
的游戏包体进行了极致压缩，并配合当地运营商的免流量策略，成功打破了硬件门
槛，打开了这一海量用户市场 。 
三、 本地化与 IP 合作：文化共情  
真正的本地化不仅是语言翻译，更是文化尊重。Vincent 举例道，在斋月
（Ramadan）期间，腾讯会在穆斯林地区推出专属活动，而在非穆斯林地区则将其
灵活包装为“黄金月（Golden Month）”，既保留了福利体系，又规避了宗教敏感
性 。在 IP 合作方面，腾讯通过对 IP 内核的深刻理解赢得了合作伙伴的尊重。
在与《龙珠》合作时，版权方看重的并非金钱，而是腾讯是否真正懂 IP（如考察
恐龙与龙珠的集数关联），这种专业度为腾讯在全球建立了卓越的行业口碑 。

e hosted Tencent management as part of their Q325 roadshow  
Chief Strategy Officer James Mitchell and Head of IR Wendy Huang gave a confident overview of 
the group’s prospects with AI dynamics taking the lions share of focus.  
Tencent confident in chip availability to sustain Gen AI ambitions  
Tencent have evolved capex plans during 2025 as the regulatory context has developed. The group 
is both using its own purchased (capex) and 3rd party leased (which are expensed) Nvidia chips as 
well as via improving domestic partner. Tencent expect capex to increase in 2026 but Chinese 
spending levels to remain well below US hyperscaler peers. Management is confident it is not 
compute constrained on its core business, even if Cloud segment growth (GPU renting) is impacted.  
Medium and long term Gen AI optionality remains strong with a substantial moat 
Tencent is benefiting from a meaningful AI tailwind in its Ad business which is growing at high teens 
YoY. Management sees various benefits across the group but a key focus is the AI application 
opportunity including agentic functions for Wechat and Mini programmes with Tencent’s advantages 
significant (social graph, payments, interoperability). The group is focused on continued 
improvement of its foundational model as part of these ambitions but has important advantages 
across the space (eg strong training data for text to video models). In a fast­moving space Tencent’s 
moats remain robust including its unique social ecosystem and position in the application layer 
Reiterate Outperform; more to come

季）、海外《无畏契约》手游版等。

AI：姚顺宇入职后首次公开发声，强调 AI 应用分化 
前 OpenAI 研究员姚顺宇近日首次以“腾讯总裁办公室首席科学家”身份亮相 
AGI-Next 峰会。他表示，AI 应用正出现明显分化：企业侧愿为更强模型付溢价，
因为“模型越强、生产率越高”；而消费者在多数场景下并不需要最强模型，ChatGPT 
的体验已从震撼转向“增强版搜索”。他强调 Claude Code 正在重塑计算机行业，用
户正在从写代码转向“用英语与电脑交流”，软件工程链条正在被重新定义。AI 的
商业化价值仍处早期阶段，人与人的差距将取决于是否会使用 AI 工具。谈及腾讯，
他表示腾讯 To C 基因强、场景丰富，在中国做 To B 更具挑战，但团队将优先“把

to Rmb125.9bn, with current deferred revs. +15% yoy and +1% qoq. Total VAS sub was

results.title: 腾讯控股(0700.HK)4Q25 PREVIEW：INLINE GP;COMMITTED AND CONSISTENT AI STRATEGIES
results.section:
3
michael.meng@bocigroup.com
Tencent Holdings
4Q25 preview: Inline GP; Committed and consistent AI strategies
We model 13% YoY inline topline in 4Q25 mainly driven by solid 18% 
YoY online game and resilient 17% YoY online ad. RMB60.4bn 
forecasted operating profit was slightly below consensus by 1% 
despite GP being inline due to increased AI-related Opex. We believe 
the Co. is dedicated to executing consistent AI strategies to generate 
high quality growth engines on its vibrant users, communities, content, 
infrastructures and monetisation ecosystems. Maintain BUY and 
slightly raise our SOTP TP to HK$742.0.   
Key Factors for Rating

Enhanced growth engines on consistent AI strategies. We expect high 
quality growth engines will sustain on healthy user, community, content and 
monetisation ecosystems empowered by its committed and consistent AI 
investments and strategies. Specifically for AI strategies, Co. will continue to i) 
upgrade and reiterate foundation LLM; ii) integrate with more in-house 
functionalities and infrastructures especially Weixin; iii) develop, launch and 
promote diverse AI products; and iv) prioritise developing own capabilities over 
external monetisations. We see game and online ad are bearing fruits with AI 
empowerments and expect sustainable growth momentum to continue in 
coming years contributed by consistent driving forces. Thus, we raise our 
FY2026-27E topline forecasts by 1%, mainly driven by 2-3% increase of game 
estimates. We nudge down our FY2025-27E bottom line estimates to factor in 
more AI-related opex assumptions. 

4Q25 preview: Inline topline; Increasing AI-related opex. We model 
total revenue will grow at 13% YoY to RMB194.8bn, in line with consensus. We 
estimate 14% YoY VAS revenue driven by 7% YoY social network and 18% YoY 
online game. Within online game, we forecast solid 15% YoY domestic games 
contributed by several top evergreen franchises across terminals and newly 
launched Valorant Mobile. Online ad
